title: Ticket #6432: notifications when job fails with exit code
description:
There has been previous discussion and confusion within LIGO and on the htcondor-users list about the behavior of notifications on "notification = Error". Many users reasonably believe this to mean that if the job exits with a code other than 0 that they will receive an e-mail notification. In fact, it only generates a notification when a job exits abnormally.

I think it would be reasonable to hard-wire this into "notification = Error" or perhaps "notification = Failure". I think "Error" is better because the difference is not self-evident to users. 

> Todd / etc:
>
> Should we, in fact, expect "notification = error" to generate e-mails
> upon exit code != 0 in Condor 8.5.8+? Todd's e-mail implies that we
> should, but I don't see evidence of that in the release notes.
>

The success_exit_code stuff in v8.5.8+ is used in conjunction with
max_retries and retry_until submit macros (i.e. first-class job retries
similar to dagman), but was not wired into notification=error.  I think
it should be.... If LIGO agrees and want this, I could make a ticket
with the specifics for your review, add it into v8.7.x and provide a
config blurb you can put into condor_config on v8.6.x to get the same
effect (courtesy job transforms, of course!).
